page.title: 15ORNITHOLOGY (PART TWO)
page.content: The intertidal area at the estauries of the Rivers Garnock and Irvine is known as the Bogside Flats.This is a {Site of Special Scientific Interest} which is the only salt marsh between the Clyde and the Solway Firth. It attracts thousands of waders and wildfowl in the winter. {Some 2% of Britain's population of {golden plovers}winter on Bogside Flats,along with hundreds of lapwings, teal and wigeon(to name but a few).In late summer the estuary attracts relatively rare birds such as black-tailed godwits and greenshanks. The highest grey heron count (55) for Ayrshire was recorded there in 1984 and as many as 10 short-eared owls were recorded on one occasion.
